00022 #ifndef PROCESSOR_H
00023 #define PROCESSOR_H
00024 
00025 #include "global.h"
00026 
00027 void processorInit(void);
00028 
00029 
00030 /******************************************************************************
00031  *
00032  * MACRO Name: ISR_ENTRY()
00033  *
00034  * Description:
00035  *    This MACRO is used upon entry to an ISR.  The current version of
00036  *    the gcc compiler for ARM does not produce correct code for
00037  *    interrupt routines to operate properly with THUMB code.  The MACRO
00038  *    performs the following steps:
00039  *
00040  *    1 - Adjust address at which execution should resume after servicing
00041  *        ISR to compensate for IRQ entry
00042  *    2 - Save the non-banked registers r0-r12 and lr onto the IRQ stack.
00043  *    3 - Get the status of the interrupted program is in SPSR.
00044  *    4 - Push it onto the IRQ stack as well.
00045  *
00046  *****************************************************************************/
00047 #define ISR_ENTRY() asm volatile(" sub   lr, lr,#4\n" \
00048                                  " stmfd sp!,{r0-r12,lr}\n" \
00049                                  " mrs   r1, spsr\n" \
00050                                  " stmfd sp!,{r1}")
00051 
00052 /******************************************************************************
00053  *
00054  * MACRO Name: ISR_EXIT()
00055  *
00056  * Description:
00057  *    This MACRO is used to exit an ISR.  The current version of the gcc
00058  *    compiler for ARM does not produce correct code for interrupt
00059  *    routines to operate properly with THUMB code.  The MACRO performs
00060  *    the following steps:
00061  *
00062  *    1 - Recover SPSR value from stack       
00063  *    2 - and restore  its value                   
00064  *    3 - Pop the return address & the saved general registers from
00065  *        the IRQ stack & return
00066  *
00067  *****************************************************************************/
00068 #define ISR_EXIT()  asm volatile(" ldmfd sp!,{r1}\n" \
00069                                  " msr   spsr_c,r1\n" \
00070                                  " ldmfd sp!,{r0-r12,pc}^")
00071 
00072 /******************************************************************************
00073  *
00074  * Function Name: disableIRQ()
00075  *
00076  * Description:
00077  *    This function sets the IRQ disable bit in the status register
00078  *
00079  * Calling Sequence: 
00080  *    void
00081  *
00082  * Returns:
00083  *    previous value of CPSR
00084  *
00085  *****************************************************************************/
00086 unsigned disableIRQ(void);
00087 
00088 /******************************************************************************
00089  *
00090  * Function Name: enableIRQ()
00091  *
00092  * Description:
00093  *    This function clears the IRQ disable bit in the status register
00094  *
00095  * Calling Sequence: 
00096  *    void
00097  *
00098  * Returns:
00099  *    previous value of CPSR
00100  *
00101  *****************************************************************************/
00102 unsigned enableIRQ(void);
00103 
00104 /******************************************************************************
00105  *
00106  * Function Name: restoreIRQ()
00107  *
00108  * Description:
00109  *    This function restores the IRQ disable bit in the status register
00110  *    to the value contained within passed oldCPSR
00111  *
00112  * Calling Sequence: 
00113  *    void
00114  *
00115  * Returns:
00116  *    previous value of CPSR
00117  *
00118  *****************************************************************************/
00119 unsigned restoreIRQ(unsigned oldCPSR);
00120 
00121 /******************************************************************************
00122  *
00123  * Function Name: disableFIQ()
00124  *
00125  * Description:
00126  *    This function sets the FIQ disable bit in the status register
00127  *
00128  * Calling Sequence: 
00129  *    void
00130  *
00131  * Returns:
00132  *    previous value of CPSR
00133  *
00134  *****************************************************************************/
00135 unsigned disableFIQ(void);
00136 
00137 /******************************************************************************
00138  *
00139  * Function Name: enableFIQ()
00140  *
00141  * Description:
00142  *    This function clears the FIQ disable bit in the status register
00143  *
00144  * Calling Sequence: 
00145  *    void
00146  *
00147  * Returns:
00148  *    previous value of CPSR
00149  *
00150  *****************************************************************************/
00151 unsigned enableFIQ(void);
00152 
00153 /******************************************************************************
00154  *
00155  * Function Name: restoreIRQ()
00156  *
00157  * Description:
00158  *    This function restores the FIQ disable bit in the status register
00159  *    to the value contained within passed oldCPSR
00160  *
00161  * Calling Sequence: 
00162  *    void
00163  *
00164  * Returns:
00165  *    previous value of CPSR
00166  *
00167  *****************************************************************************/
00168 unsigned restoreFIQ(unsigned oldCPSR);
